intro: Iris humilis subsp. cretensis, commonly known as the Cretan iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the island of Crete. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate. It is a low-growing species with a compact habit, often found in open habitats such as slopes and meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
